attributes.action: Compel the British Broadcasting Corporation to at least pay lip service to GNU/Linux
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Now that the GNU/Linux Operating Environment is fully mainstream, the BBC is seen by many to be laxadaisical in its approach to this as a viable option to their giving of advice to home and business computer users in their half hour skit known as "Click". They pay lip service to the BSD-based Apple Mac OS, which itself may be easily replaced by the Linux platform, as can PCs supplied with Microsoft's xp or Vista. This single action would solve 99% of common problems eg malware, kernel crashes, suffered on a daily basis by any Microsoft or Apple Mac OS user, as none can deny with a straight face.

reasons: Commercial endorsement, promotion of any product, service or publication, or statements that amount to adverts
Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
